radiographic_examinations.findings: The hepatic parenchyma appears within normal limits. There is a hyperechoic lesion in segment 8 of the liver compatible with known hemangioma. Mild intrahepatic biliary dilation. The gallbladder is markedly distended and contains sludge and stones. There is a stone at the gallbladder neck that is difficult to assess for mobility. The gallbladder wall appears slightly thickened. The pancreas appears within normal limits, without masses or pancreatic ductal dilation. Normal spleen echogenicity, measuring 7.9 cm. Limited views of the kidneys show no hydronephrosis.
